scan.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to examine an area carefully but quickly, often because you are looking for a particular person or thing
scan.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: He scanned the horizon, but there was no sign of the ship.
She scanned his face, looking for signs of what he was thinking.
Video cameras scanned the car park.
I scanned the street for people I knew.
scan.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: I scanned the page for her name.
scan.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: if a machine scans something, it passes an electrical beam over it to form a picture of what is inside it
scan.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: All luggage has to be scanned at the airport.
They scanned his brain for signs of damage.
scan.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: if you scan a document or picture, you put it into a machine attached to a computer so that the information in the document can be taken into the computer and stored there
scan.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: You scan the text into the computer, then edit it.
scan.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: poetry that scans has a correct regular pattern of beats
scan.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a medical test in which a special machine produces a picture of something inside your body
scan.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: The scan showed that she was expecting twins.
scan.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: a quick scan of the newspapers
scan.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: to use a scanner (=special machine with an electronic beam) to read the information on a credit card, the bar code on a product etc
scan.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: to use a scanner (=piece of computer equipment) to copy words or images from paper onto a computer
scan.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: This program lets people edit photos that have been scanned into a digital form.
